I highly recommend Ramen Menya in Shinjuku. They provide a range of broths to please sophisticated palates: chicken broth, pork bone broth, fish broth, miso broth and lastly spicy broth. The spicy broth is toned down to suit the palates of the tourists so you don’t have to worry about it being too spicy ğŸŒ¶ Of course they too serve food adapted for their own palate. The richness of broths is outstanding which can tempt demanding palates. The ramen texture is perfect that will please the most refined palate. I highly recommend it. If you’re staying at Hotel JAP Tokyo please remember the following as I work thereğŸ˜Š: First of all before washing your clothes please remove tissue and coins from the pockets and put only seventy percent of the dirty clothes in the wash tub. This will ensure your clothes to get evenly clean and the machine will less likely be out of order. Please wipe the drum with a towel after each use so as not to cause mould or mildew to grow in the wash tub. Second of all, please don’t turn the air conditioner up to more than twenty five degrees Celsius. Otherwise it won’t blow cold ğŸ¥¶ air and will smell bad.
